7.   TERM
7.1  This Agreement shall take effect from the Effective Date and continue in
     full force and effect for twenty (20) years thereafter, unless otherwise
     terminated in accordance with Clause 8.
7.2  This Agreement may be renewed for an additional term of ten (10) years by
     notice in writing given by XFN to CEIS at the expiry of the Term, for a

perturbation.changed_text:
7.   TERM
7.1  This Agreement shall take effect from the Effective Date and continue in
     full force and effect for twenty (20) years thereafter, unless otherwise
     terminated in accordance with Clause 8.
7.2  This Agreement may be renewed for an additional term of ten (10) years at the sole discretion of CEIS, without any requirement for mutual agreement or consideration.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause 7.2 states that the agreement may be renewed for an additional 10 years if XFN gives written notice and consideration is mutually agreed upon. The modified clause gives CEIS sole discretion over renewal, contradicting the need for mutual agreement and consideration, making the renewal terms uncertain.

perturbation.original_text:
8.   TERMINATION
8.1  XFN may terminate this Agreement by giving thirty (30) days written notice
     to the CEIS.
8.2  Either Party may terminate this Agreement:
     (a)  if the other Party commits a material breach of this Agreement which
          is not capable of being remedied;
     (b)  if the other Party commits a material breach of this Agreement which
          is capable of being remedied but not remedied within thirty (30) days
          upon receiving written notice from the non-breaching party requiring
          remedy; and
     (c)  if the other Party becomes insolvent or bankrupt.
8.3  Upon termination of the Agreement:
     (a)  CEIS shall terminate the transmission of the Content with immediate
          effect; and
     (b)  in the event that this Agreement is terminated prior to the expiry of
          the Term, XFN shall recover any sums paid to CEIS in advance for the
          unexpired Term of this Agreement, together with interest from the date
          those sums were paid until the date of full refund.
perturbation.changed_text:
8.   TERMINATION
8.1  XFN may terminate this Agreement by giving thirty (30) days written notice to the CEIS.
8.2  Either Party may terminate this Agreement:
     (a)  if the other Party commits a material breach of this Agreement which is not capable of being remedied;
     (b)  if the other Party commits a material breach of this Agreement which is capable of being remedied but not remedied within thirty (30) days upon receiving written notice from the non-breaching party requiring remedy; and
     (c)  if the other Party becomes insolvent or bankrupt.
8.3  Upon termination of the Agreement, regardless of the reason:
     (a) CEIS may, at its sole discretion, continue or terminate the transmission of the Content;
     (b) in the event that this Agreement is terminated prior to the expiry of the Term, any sums paid to CEIS in advance for the unexpired Term of this Agreement shall be non-refundable.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause 8.3(a) mandates CEIS to terminate the transmission of Content upon termination. The modified clause introduces discretion, creating a contradiction. Similarly, the original 8.3(b) states that XFN shall recover advance payments upon early termination. The modification makes these payments non-refundable, directly contradicting the original term and introducing uncertainty about financial obligations after termination.

perturbation.original_text:
1.   DEFINITIONS AND INTERPRETATION
1.1  In this Agreement unless the context otherwise requires the following words
     shall have the following meaning:
                
"AFFILIATES"       means any company, corporation, partnership, joint venture or
                   other entity that directly or indirectly controls, is
                   controlled by or is under common control with XFN;
"CONTENT"          means real-time economic news including articles, reports,
                   data, information and such materials that have or have been
                   and/or will be published from time to time and that is or
                   will be in the possession or control of CEIS from time to
                   time, in respect of the subject matters as more particularly
                   described in Schedule 1;
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Affiliates' is based on control, whether direct or indirect. The modified definition introduces subjective designation by XFN, potentially allowing them to arbitrarily define affiliates, thus contradicting the objective control-based definition. Similarly, the original definition of "Content" relates specifically to "Schedule 1". By removing that the content must align with "schedule 1" directly contradicts the previous definition, creating uncertainty about which content is actually licensed under this agreement.
